definitions: (of a musical instrument) able to be adjusted to the correct or uniform pitch

examples.text: most of these old uprights aren't tunable

shortDefinitions: able to be adjusted to correct pitch

definitions: (of a receiver circuit such as a radio or television) able to be adjusted to the frequency of the required signal

examples.text: the radio is tunable to only a selected band of frequencies

shortDefinitions: able to be adjusted to frequency of required signal

definitions: (of an engine or mechanical parts) able to be adjusted so that a vehicle runs smoothly and efficiently

examples.text: this is a very tunable engine that can put out big power with a few mods

shortDefinitions: able to be adjusted so that vehicle runs smoothly

definitions: able to be adjusted or adapted

examples.text: two tunable lasers are used to modulate the amplitude
